revised_title: Botanicum Hortense: A 1713 Account of Diverse Rare Plants in London Gardens
tldr: In 1713, James Petiver, F.R.S., documented various rare plants observed in London gardens, including the Society of Apothecaries' Physick Garden at Chelsea. The article highlights unique ferns, flowers, grasses, and other plants, providing descriptions and insights into their growth and characteristics.
